doc:
Gail Fisher https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gail_Fisher 0 Gail Fisher (August 18, 1935 – December 2, 2000) was an American actress who was one of the first black women to play substantive roles in American television. She was best known for playing the role of secretary Peggy Fair on the television detective series Mannix from 1968 through 1975, a role for which she won two Golden Globe Awards and an Emmy Award; she was the first black woman to win either award. She also won an NAACP Image Award in 1969. Gail_Fisher ( August_18_,_1935 – December_2_,_2000 ) was an_American_actress who was one of the_first_black_women to_play substantive_roles in American_television . She was_best_known for playing the_role of secretary_Peggy_Fair on the_television_detective_series_Mannix from 1968 through 1975 , a_role for which she won two_Golden_Globe_Awards and an_Emmy_Award ; she was the_first_black_woman to_win_either_award . She also won an_NAACP_Image_Award in 1969 .
